website_summaries.verdict: These premium computer speakers are the perfect combination of the latest hassle-free wireless technology and the best high-fidelity analog sound available. A must-have for hardcore music enthusiasts.
pros: Effortless to set up and play
cons: Audioengine speakers look great and sound better, but these computer speakers are expensive

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great and the Bluetooth connectivity range is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great and the Bluetooth connectivity range is amazing. Using these with a cherrywood Teac turntable and can’t believe the room filling sound these small speakers put out. My only gripe is that the color between the two speakers is way off. I get that natural wood products can vary in appearance but in my case the left and right speakers are a very different shade of cherrywood red. They are not even close when putting them side by side. Disappointing for speakers that cost more than the turntable itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sound slowly ramps up to set volume
customer_reviews.text: I noticed right away a problem playing audio files (with Media Player, Audacity, or Sound Forge Audio Studio). It takes about 2 seconds for the sound to ramp up to full volume, I miss the first 2 seconds of sound. These same audio files worked fine with my old speakers. I contacted Audioengine and got this reply "this is something we've seen when testing the HD3s in our offices, so this appears to be normal; there wouldn't be a way to prevent this from happening, from what we can tell. We can definitely see how this would be an issue, though.". Yup, it's an issue all right, as soon as I find a good replacement I'm sending these back.
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great value
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with these speakers. Got them to use at work in a private office and they sound amazing. They are on my desk a few feet away from me. A few key points: - Sounds great at low and high volumes - Soundscape is well done - Balanced sound with a slight weight to the low to low-mids (which I like). Will say that the lowest frequency response is a little weak but for this price and the speaker size, the frequency arrange is excellent. Using bluetooth connect from my computer, could work to improve sound with DAC, wires, etc. but this is convenient with a satisfying sound.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: If you have the budget, these sound absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have been in audio heaven since installing these speakers. I used the USB connection in order to take advantage of the in-speaker amp. If they're playing softly, moderately, or blasting, the sound definition is amazing. The sound stage is also amazing. It's a well defined wall of sound come from my desk into my ears. 60w is plenty of juice for at a desk. I have the sub-woofer on my wishlist for Christmas, and am considering setting up some A5s for my home theater.
customer_reviews.author: KillamityJayne

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sound for their size, but needs a subwoofer to be AWESOME.
customer_reviews.text: On their own, the HD3's perform impressively for their small size, but low bass is absent. Sound clarity and imaging are excellent. USB audio with the PC and bluetooth with the iPhone both work well. Sitting as close to them as I do at my computer desk, the 15-watt per speaker output is plenty. It was only after turning on the 125-watt S8 subwoofer that this system became awesome across the full frequency range.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little speakers with great sound!
customer_reviews.text: These are great wireless speakers for a medium sized space. I have them both in my family room and then up at my cabin and love them. Sound is excellent and fills the room nicely. There is no main controls, just the speakers and they hook up and work right away. Only complaint is that the cable hookups/connectors in the back of the speakers are really deep/overly long , meaning that you can't have them flush against the wall and from the side they look clumsy there. Otherwise they look great in either the wood finish or the white (I have one set of each) and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Lynch

customer_reviews.title: For the price these little things are amazing, but even better with a subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: These definitely have a break in period, but once broken in they really shine. Great sound field from the built in DAC and wonderful mids and highs. The bass isn't bad and for the size of the speaker, it is remarkably good, but after I paired it with the S8 subwoofer, these little babies went off of the charts. Great full, spacious sound. Much better than the Bose companionship 5's that I purchased these to replace.
customer_reviews.author: c-mans diet

customer_reviews.title: Poor Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: You are paying for decent sound quality and materials with these speakers. Bluetooth is a serious problem. If you plan on using Bluetooth forget it. It takes multiple attempts to pair with our smartphones. We would enjoy these speakers if we could use them with music streaming. The odd thing is our HD6 works without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmos

customer_reviews.title: Buy this and pair it with the S8 Sub.  Blown away.
customer_reviews.text: These look great and sound great when paired with the S8 Sub. You will be blown away. For a desktop computer setup, I can't imagine it getting much better. Without the sub, you might want to look into the HD6 speakers if you have room on your desk, because the HD3s will not fill out the low frequencies. I use Tidal running through the integrated DAC. The only small issue, is that that the speakers wait for a signal before the amp/dac turns on. This will always cut off the first second or two of a song after they go into standby mode.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound from a small package
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older Logitech 2.1 system with these. Had an issue with sound-pops at first, but it was a problem with the USB ports on my motherboard (old Lenovo S20), plugged into a seperate 3.0 card and resolved the issue. I was planning on getting a subwoofer for these - either Audioengine or Klipsch, but I quickly found the speakers alone are more than adequate for listening to music, movies, etc. in my home office so never added one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely slaps
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are incredible. I swapped to these from the larger Audioengine A5+ and I much prefer these, particularly in a small area for nearfield use at a desk. The A5+ boom overwhelmingly whereas the HD3 are tight and controlled. The HD3 can also get to impressive volume levels for their tiny size. Beautiful build quality, and they intelligently handle power and multiple analog+Bluetooth connections, too. These are basically perfect desk speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Sullivan McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Well built, excellent audio quality
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound absolutely fantastic! I use them via USB cable to my laptop and Bluetooth occasionally. It's hard to hear the sound quality difference between the two connections which is impressive given one is bluetooth. The speaker's packaging was perfect and absolutely enjoy these. They aren't cheap but love the sound they produce and are a must have for people who listen to music frequently while they work.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good mids, needs a subwoofer especially at lower volumes.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much exactly what I was expecting. Good, not great sound quality. The only issue with the sound is that it really needs a subwoofer if you listen to music with a fair amount of base. The looks somewhat exceeded my expectations. It looks very good on my desk, especially the cherry finish.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers
customer_reviews.text: Led Zeppelin’s Black Dog was the test song. Passed with flying colors. Since I’m spending more time working from home these speakers have allowed me to enjoy my music library of rock, jazz, blues and instrumentals. Excellent sound quality, size and value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: PHart

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Linux - Tech Support is not helpful
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a couple weeks ago, been fighting with them ever since. Plugging into the USB - the driver does not consistently work with Linux OS. Randomly drops, reboot will sometimes reactivate the sound for awhile, but it drops before long. Bluetooth connection is somewhat more reliable, but overpowered to the point that it knocks out my wifi connection (regardless of what channel I'm on). I reached out to tech support, and they responded with a boilerplate email that didn't address any of the questions I asked. When I tried to reach them again, I didn't even get a response. Overall, decent enough speakers (when they work) - but if anything goes sideways, you're completely on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speakers
customer_reviews.text: These speakers support several of the input types that I need: - USB output from a computer without a good soundcard. - Bluetooth Switching between the different inputs is also done automatically without me having to do anything. I got the subwoofer with these. All together, they sound pretty amazing for the size.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Great set of small speakers
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound quality for the size and money. Great set of speakers to make a small room a party! Also great as computer speakers. I definitely recommend using small speaker stands to enhance the sound quality. I love that these have a volume/power knob in the front and have a switch to increase or decrease bass. Pair with an Audioengine subwoofer for a fantastic experience.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely amazed at the sound quality coming from these tiny speakers. Every string of the guitar, the hi-hat on the drum kit and vocal sublties I just had not heard before. I was a bit reluntant based to order these based on the price but as soon as I started listening I totally forgot about any worries about cost. I've been listening to more music than ever before. Just need to keep the volume down as the urge is to crank it up now.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Sound was too tiny to keep.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the aesthetics. Sound was too tiny for me, so returned them. Wish they made HD4’s. I’d be all over that. HD6’s are too big & too expensive, but thinking to try them anyway. since that’s all that’s available upstream from AE.
customer_reviews.author: 4renzixs

customer_reviews.title: HD3
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, after break-in and paired with an S8 Subwoofer, it’s my go to setup. My HD6’s aren’t even plugged in at the moment. I highly recommend these. If the price is an issue to with the A2+ and if you enjoy casual music in the bedroom or bathroom go with the 512. I would only recommend the Audioengine A5+ over the HD3.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Piccioni

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at the recommendation of a friend to replace my similar but broken Bose speakers. I got exactly what I expected except for the sound quality---these sound MUCH more crisp and clear than the Bose did. I wasn't expecting that. They sound amazing. I had a little buyer's remorse between the time I ordered them and the first time I listened to music, but not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Go Cubbies

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the brand
customer_reviews.text: Eh. I’m a big fan of my Audioengine A5s, so I had similar expectations of these handsome little guys. They sound like you are at a frat party, and someone put their phone in a red solo cup. Even with a sub attached, bass was minimal, and mid range was out to lunch. Good on them to have such a good Bluetooth interface, but why is there no optical connection?
customer_reviews.author: loveoldstandards

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for computer speakers, but they are good computer speakers
customer_reviews.text: These sound clear and accurate to me (though I'm no audiophile). Bass is middling due to the small size, but acceptable. Bluetooth function works great. I ended up buying their plastic doorstop stands for this which do help, but are overpriced. In sum, I'm satisfied with their function, but question the value per dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Mr guy

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with the sub woofer. This is a fantastic product. Sounds great! This was well worth it for book shelf speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I'd do it again.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little unsure when I first saw these speakers. With all the input options, built In dac, shielding for other electronics, and a good company reputation i decided to go for it. Honestly, they sound awesome. They put out plenty of warm and clear sound. The tiny 2.75" woofers puts out a respectable amount of bass for its size. If you want the full bass experience a sub would do. Everything seems well built, cords and all. I hope to keep these around for a while.
customer_reviews.author: ian imlach

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how good these sound, especially when paired with a subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Greenstone

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: Great little speakers. I am a filmmaker and hearing things properly is key. The sound quality is great. Just the right amount of bass. These can get loud too. They are very compact which fits great on any desk and look lovely.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Vallejo

customer_reviews.title: Love em!
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure of what to buy but i went with the hd3s and I'm so happy with the purchase. Great sound, quality and overall look and feel of the speakers. Bit expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: HJcuebas

customer_reviews.title: Need a sub
customer_reviews.text: These are great little speakers but they do need a subwoofer to open up the bottom end. Once you do that you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jim47

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, slightly high price
customer_reviews.text: These amplified speakers really deliver well, about the best bass response I've heard in small portable speakers. Very easy and convenient to directly connect or use with any device that supports bluetooth. They are somewhat expensive however. The fit and finish is really superb.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the size
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good clarity from these little guys. Plentiful volume for my kitchen where they are being used. Bluetooth connection works flawlessly so far. Noticeably better sound quality compared to the more common standalone/portable bluetooth speakers I've listened to, which I had hoped for given these are relatively pricey.
customer_reviews.author: baby_diego

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers for Desktop Computer
customer_reviews.text: Very good range; no distortion on the high and low ends. Shouldn't have had to pay tax as the website promoted Amazon and said no tax but when we used our own amazon account we had to pay tax.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome speakers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect speakers for the laptop. All the reviews I read online were spot on. I love these speakers. If you really want bass, get the companion sub woofer. But, perfectly usable without it
customer_reviews.author: Erik S

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! The sound quality is incredible. Very easy to connect with bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic powered speakers. Incredible quality, impressive sound. EZ connect to wired & bluetooth devices. What's not to love?!
customer_reviews.author: jedisista

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe all that sound comes from these tiny speakers! Truly impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Audio from someone how never has had built in amp system
customer_reviews.text: Really the price should not be a question on the sound these little guys make, and build quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: OMAR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound and great looking too
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, compact and they look fantastic on my desktop. I could not be happier. Would buy again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. White

customer_reviews.title: Great for small space
customer_reviews.text: Small but pack a punch! & versatile. Great for small space living
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mansberger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality sound, if you like bass you'll need a subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: Bijan

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers. Purchased as a gift for my son to use in his dorm. He loves the options to connect to his phone, laptop etc. Sound quality is excellent for their size.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: The sound is by far an upgrade to my old speakers, I added my own sub. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: NoTrip

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but still has its issues
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality and bass. Perfect for small home desktop setups. However, there is still the issue of a slight delay of 2-3 seconds when playing a song/video after a period of pausing/not using it. The wood that is used isn't smoothly cut and had some slight shavings that fall off. Overall, great sound but average quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Set of Speakers
customer_reviews.text: One of the best desktop speakers I had ever owned! Soundstage is simply jaw dropping.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Radionov

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful desktop speaker
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful desktop speaker! Far exceeded my expectations and a bargain at the price. Best desktop speaker I've ever heard.
customer_reviews.author: DGR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound from these smaller speakers and they look great on my Cherry book case.
customer_reviews.author: Dale S.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely better than a sound bar
customer_reviews.text: Definitely better than a sound bar. I realize it's not fair but my base comparison is with a pair of Klipsch tower speakers with a Yamaha amp. Great for what they do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: These speakers made a huge difference in my office sound. I paired them with a Polk subwoofer, although no doubt the AudioEngine sub would have been killer. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: IrishJazz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Speakers were easy to connect and the sound they produce is loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's great if you're expecting a desktop speaker
customer_reviews.text: I got them a few days ago. Tested them for an hour and they perform really well. It's great if you're expecting a desktop speaker. P.S. There's a little gap under the silver plate that blows air out when you turn it up. I don't know what it does but i love that :P
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: Far exceeded my expectations. Built well and sound is great. Suited for sitting at a desk, not sure how they hold up much farther away from audience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect loud speakers
customer_reviews.text: I like the aesthetics and well built quality of the speakers. On the downside, they are unable to achieve the decibel level I desire while working with Logic Pro X.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, solid sound, too expensive, DAC problematic under linux
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and very good build quality. The DAC is problematic under linux. I am not sure if pulseaudio is the reason for that or the DAC itself. The Bluetooth works flawlessly and it is very convenient. Pros: - Good and solid sound for its dimensions - A quality product overall. Perfect fit and finish - Front volume knob and 3.5mm stereo mini-jack on the front - The Bluetooth works flawlessly Cons: - Too expensive! - The DAC is problematic under linux. I almost returned it because of this.
customer_reviews.author: pn

customer_reviews.title: We were excited to give these a shot, but....
customer_reviews.text: Small sound from small speakers. The connectivity features of these speakers are excellent, but the sound does not have a lot of depth. After listening to these for a while, I had various problems with my first pair such as, one speaker louder than the other, pairing issues, hissing/hum even at low volumes, and the back of the main speaker getting extremely hot causing clipping issues. I received another pair and I am not at all impressed with the sound. They can get loud, but it is not a good or warm loud and to sum up the sound, "very bland". We are looking to replace, maybe Vanatoo T1 this time.
customer_reviews.author: RoBro

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: it's all right not as loud as I expected but if u have a desktop setup that wooden table or tabletop and small room then I would likely recommend this one. It's nice small, louder than other small speakers can provide.
customer_reviews.author: Minh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best speakers I have ever owned and the perfect size to boot!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Extremely meh. Definitely not worth the price. Klipsch ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely meh. Definitely not worth the price. Klipsch Promedia 2.1 are way cheaper and vastly out perform these.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J Kadera

customer_reviews.title: looks good, and so easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Compact, looks good, and so easy to setup. But, despite the audio clarity, this thing definitely needs a sub. And once you add that, it makes the whole package too pricey. This is a speaker system definitely made only for the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Leopoldo Prieto

customer_reviews.title: These speakers have a very good sound, but not 400 dollar good
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have a very good sound, but not 400 dollar good. I would compare them to my $300 Bose.
customer_reviews.author: bobls

customer_reviews.title: I was really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't fit any standard 3.5mm Headphones into the front Headphone output without applying massive pressure. can't pull the Headphones out either. Broke my Klipsch x11 Headphones jack in the process of pulling them out. One of the main reasons I've decided to buy these speakers is because they seemed to have a convenient front headphone output. needless to say, I was really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great features and nice size, but the sound is pretty poor for the price. It's about on par with what you'd get from an Echo or the built-in speakers on an iMac. Based on reviews, I expected these to be much more competitive on sound quality with passive speakers in a similar price range, but they're not — you're paying for the features, not the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Arment

product_meta.title: Audioengine HD3 60W Wireless Powered Desktop Speakers, Bluetooth aptX HD, USB 24-Bit DAC & Analog Amplifier (Black)
feature_bullets: POWERED BLUETOOTH SPEAKERS WITH 100 FOOT RANGE: The HD3 Bluetooth Speakers feature built-in analog power amplifiers that bring you incredible audio. The aptX HD Bluetooth codec with 100 foot range and 24-bit DAC allow you to bypass the low-quality sound card in your laptop or phone to deliver premium quality sound.

FEATURES Small speakers with a big sound that fills any room, premium Bluetooth wireless that works with all your devices and apps and high-end sound wrapped in hand-built wood cabinets. Simple setup, no receiver needed, no network setup, no passwords, front panel volume control and headphone jack. Bluetooth, USB, RCA & 3.5mm inputs.

WORKS WITH Turntables with built-in or external preamps, all music players: phones, desktop computers, laptops, notebooks, TVs with an analog output, CD and DVD players, video game consoles and all products with 1/8" mini-jack or RCA outputs

WHAT’S INCLUDED: Pair of Audioengine HD3 Wireless Powered Speakers, Bluetooth antenna, 2m speaker wire, power supply & cord, 1.5m 3.5mm mini-jack audio cable, 1.5m USB cable, microfiber speaker bags and cable bags, setup guide, brochure

WARRANTY: Audioengine builds quality speakers that they stand behind. All Audioengine products come with a 3-year transferable warranty. COVERAGE: Stellar US based customer support and 3 year product coverage is included. Based in Austin, TX, Audioengine has been changing the way people listen to music since 2005. Our passion is creating products that sound great, are easy to use, and make people want to listen to music every day.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars53 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
